experiment_info.name: adaptive_nm_iterations
experiment_info.description: Dynamically adjust NM polish iterations based on convergence rate
experiment_info.hypothesis: Some samples converge quickly (4-5 NM iters), others need more (10+). Fixed 8 iters is wasteful for easy samples, insufficient for hard ones.

tuning_runs.notes: Adaptive batched approach - stops early based on convergence. Similar time to fixed 8 but lower score.
Source-count based: fewer iters for 1-src, more for 2-src. WORST result - more 2-src iters adds significant time.
Fixed 8/8 with my optimizer - BEST of my runs. Similar to baseline but cannot beat documented baseline (1.1688 @ 58.4 min).
Ran original baseline for comparison. Also OVER BUDGET and different from documented 1.1688 @ 58.4 min.

baseline_to_beat.note: DOCUMENTED baseline. Cannot reproduce - current runs get ~1.16 @ 78-88 min.

conclusion.reason: Adaptive NM iterations does NOT improve over fixed 8 iterations
key_findings: 1. Adaptive batched approach adds overhead from multiple minimize() calls
2. Source-count based (6/10) is WORSE - more 2-src iters adds time without accuracy gain
4. Cannot reproduce documented baseline (1.1688 @ 58.4 min) - current hardware/conditions give ~1.16 @ 80 min
